channel.title: Will Reed
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

item.description: William Reed, Professor in the Department of Government and Politics, is Assistant Provost for Academic Planning. As a Big-10 DEO and University of Maryland ADVANCE Leadership Fellow, Reed is recognized for his ability to navigate and elevate complex organizations and dedication to supporting students, faculty, and staff. In addition, Reed is a scholar with numerous articles published in prestigious academic journals such as the American Political Science Review, American Journal of Political Science, and the Journal of Politics.

Reed, William. "A unified statistical model of conflict onset and escalation." American Journal of Political Science (2000): 84-93.
Reed, William, and Daina Chiba. "Decomposing the relationship between contiguity and militarized conflict." American Journal of Political Science 54.1 (2010): 61-73.
Reed, William. "Information, power, and war." American Political Science Review 97.4 (2003): 633-641.
Reed, William, et al. "War, power, and bargaining." The Journal of Politics 70.4 (2008): 1203-1216.
